# City Council

### There are several options to connect with your elected officials.

- Select the blue circle for *general topics* that says "Contact Council" or [email](mailto:council@ashland.or.us) them.
- Select the green circle for *agenda items or upcoming actions* that says "Public Comment for City Council" or email the Council [testimony email](mailto:public-testimony@ashlandoregon.gov).
- **Attend a meeting** and fill out an on-site Speaker Request Form.
- **Visit a Councilor** at City Hall, 20 E Main St. during office Hours:
  
  - Jeff Dahle - third Monday of the month, 2 to 3:30
  - Gina DuQuenne - first Thursday of the month, noon to 1:30
  - Bob Kaplan - first Monday of the month, 1 to 2:30
- Attend a **Coffee &amp; Conversation** **event:**
  
  - May 13, 1:30 to 3, at Oal Knoll Golf Course
  - June 17, 1 to 2:30, at Railroad Park
  - July 16, 11:30 to 1, at Garfield Park
  - August 12, 5 to 6:30, at Hunter Park
  - Septempter 10, 3:30 to 5, at Enders Shelter
  - October 14, 1 to 2:30 at North Mountain Park Pavilion

1. ![](https://ashlandoregon.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=3590 "DerekSherrell_274")
   
   #### Derek Sherrell
   
   City Councilor
   
   [Email Derek Sherrell](mailto:derek.sherrell@council.ashlandoregon.gov)
   
   Derek Sherrell was appointed to City Council in June of 2025 with a term ending December 2026.
   
   \*City Charter Article III Section 4 - The appointee's term of office shall begin immediately upon appointment and shall continue until a successor, elected at the next biennial election, takes office for the unexpired term.

Ashland has a Council-Manager form of government, with much of the City's business evolving through citizen committees that enhance public support and political stability.

The City Council is elected to serve as the governing body for Ashland's 21,360 residents (Portland State University Population Research Center certified population for 2020). The Mayor, who presides at the Council meetings, is elected at-large for a four-year term. Six Council members are elected at-large for four-year staggered terms.

**Business Meeting****Study Session** 6 p.m.5:30 p.m.1st and 3rd Tuesday of each monthThe Monday prior to each Business MeetingCouncil Chambers - 1175 E Main StCouncil Chambers - 1175 E Main St

City Council meetings are televised live on RVTV and on Spectrum. The public can attend in person at Council Chambers at 1175 E Main Street. More information is found on the [Watch a Meeting](https://ashlandoregon.gov/740/Watch-a-Meeting) page.

**Agenda and Minutes****Council Information** Agendas are available on Friday before the meetings. [Ordinances](https://records.ashland.or.us/WebLink/Browse.aspx?dbid=0&cr=1)[View Agendas and Minutes](https://or-ashland.civicplus.com/129/Agendas-Minutes)[Resolutions](https://records.ashland.or.us/WebLink/Browse.aspx?dbid=0&cr=1)[Watch a meeting](https://www.ashlandoregon.gov/740/Watch-a-Meeting) (Live or archived)[Proclamations](https://records.ashland.or.us/WebLink/Browse.aspx?dbid=0&cr=1)  
[Look Ahead (PDF)](https://ashlandoregon.gov/DocumentCenter/View/3577/Look-Ahead-61225) (Topics for upcoming agendas)  
[2024 Council Liaison Appointments (PDF)](https://www.ashlandoregon.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1827/City-Council-Liaison-Appointments-2024)  
[Archived Council Records on Laserfiche](https://records.ashland.or.us/WebLink/Browse.aspx?id=5&dbid=0&repo=CITY-RECORDS&cr=1)[Council Handbook (PDF)](https://www.ashlandoregon.gov/DocumentCenter/View/3006)

**Submit Public Comment**  
Public comment is welcome on public forum topics and agenda items during Business Meetings, as well as on agenda items during Study Sessions.

- If you would like to speak **in person**, during a meeting, please complete a Speaker Request Form available at the meeting location.
- To speak electronically during the meeting or to submit written comments in advance, please complete the online [Public Comment Form](https://www.ashlandoregon.gov/FormCenter/City-Recorder-5/City-Council-Public-Testimony-Form-92) by 10 a.m. the day of the meeting.
  
  - Be sure to indicate whether you are submitting **written comments** or requesting to **speak electronically.**
  - Written comments submitted by the deadline will be provided to the Mayor and City Council prior to the meeting.

All public testimony will be part of the official record.

For more information, [email](mailto:recorder@ashlandoregon.gov) the City Recorder's Office or call 541-488-5307.

Stay in the Know without Lifting a Finger!

From feel-good community stories to can’t-miss events and City updates, our **City e-Newsletter** brings it all straight to your inbox. No digging, no scrolling, just the good stuff, all in one spot! [**Sign up Now for City e-News!**](https://lp.constantcontactpages.com/sl/eWmTexv/CityeNews) 

Want to be *really* in the loop? You can also [sign up for instant alerts](https://ashlandoregon.gov/list.aspx) whenever we drop a news release or add something to the City calendar. Because being in the know is way more fun!
